origin: Latin: prae- meaning "before, in front of"
explanation: Pre- là một tiền tố có nguồn gốc từ tiếng Latinh, mang ý nghĩa chính là **trước** hoặc **trước đó**. Nó thường chỉ ra một hành động, trạng thái, hoặc vị trí xảy ra **trước** một thời điểm, sự kiện hoặc vật thể khác.
level_note: Từ vựng sử dụng tiền tố "pre-" phổ biến từ cấp độ B1 đến C1.

words.logic: pre- (trước) + dict (nói) -> nói trước điều gì đó sẽ xảy ra.
words.meaning_en: to say what will happen in the future
words.example: Experts predict that the economy will grow next year.

collocations.example: She believes she can predict the future.
It's difficult to predict the outcome of this match.

forms.example: His prediction about the weather was correct.
The movie's ending was quite predictable.
Predictably, she was late as usual.

parts.meaning: sắp xếp, chuẩn bị (to make ready)

words.logic: pre- (trước) + pare (sắp xếp/chuẩn bị) -> sắp xếp mọi thứ trước khi một sự kiện xảy ra để sẵn sàng đón nhận nó.
words.meaning_en: to make something ready for use or for a particular purpose
words.example: We need to prepare for the upcoming exam.

collocations.example: My mother is preparing a meal for dinner.
Students are preparing for their final exams.
You should prepare thoroughly for the interview.

forms.example: The preparation for the conference is complete.
He is always prepared for any situation.

words.logic: pre- (trước) + view (nhìn/xem) -> hành động nhìn hoặc xem một cái gì đó trước khi nó được công bố hoặc trình chiếu đầy đủ.
words.meaning_en: an opportunity to see something before it is shown to the general public
words.example: We got a preview of the new movie before its official release.

collocations.example: The cinema will have a movie preview tonight.
I got a preview of the new design plans.
Only special guests received an exclusive preview of the exhibition.

forms.example: You can preview the changes before saving them.

parts.meaning: sự cẩn trọng, cảnh báo (carefulness, warning)

words.logic: pre- (trước) + caution (cẩn trọng) -> sự cẩn trọng được thực hiện trước để ngăn chặn điều gì đó xấu xảy ra.
words.meaning_vi: biện pháp phòng ngừa, sự đề phòng
words.meaning_en: an action taken to prevent something unpleasant or dangerous from happening
words.example: Always take precautions when working with electricity.

collocations.example: We need to take safety precautions when hiking.
Safety precautions are strictly enforced at the construction site.
You should exercise caution when driving in bad weather.

forms.example: The government issued precautionary warnings about the storm.

words.logic: pre- (trước) + cede (đi) -> đi trước, tức là xảy ra hoặc xuất hiện trước một cái gì đó khác.
words.meaning_vi: đi trước, đứng trước, xảy ra trước
words.meaning_en: to happen or come before something or someone else
words.example: The introduction precedes the main body of the report.

collocations.example: His speech was preceded by a short video presentation.
The president preceded his address with a word of thanks.
A preceding event set the stage for the current crisis.

forms.example: This decision will set a dangerous precedent.
In the preceding chapter, we discussed this in more detail.
